Key Match Events: Zach LaVine scored 14 of his game-high 35 points in the fourth quarter and grabbed 10 rebounds for the game.
Nikola Vucevic had 24 points and 11 boards to lift the host Chicago Bulls to a 114-110 win over the San Antonio Spurs.
Chicago overcame a 19-point deficit that it faced in the third quarter.
Coby White’s driving layup with 47.1 seconds left in the fourth made it 111-110, giving the Bulls their first lead of the night.
The Bulls ended the game on an 11-0 run.
Chris Paul missed a desperation 3-pointer in the final second for San Antonio.
Victor Wembanyama had 23 points, 14 rebounds, and eight blocks while pacing eight Spurs scorers in double figures.
San Antonio went scoreless over the game’s final 3:52.
